summary:
• Deadly unrest spreads across Bangladesh due to disputes over job quotas.
• Protests turn violent, leading to fatalities in multiple regions.
• The government struggles to maintain order amidst growing tensions.

• Severe storms cause flooding and power outages in Toronto.
• Drake's Toronto home "The Embassy" is affected by the floods.
• The city faces significant damage due to the storm.

• In China, housing used to be a symbol of success but it has become a financial burden instead.
• Many Chinese people have seen their savings dwindle as they struggle to afford housing costs.
• As a result, the traditional notion of housing as a path to prosperity is being rewritten.

• Princess Catherine returns to the public eye after announcing her cancer diagnosis.
• The Olympic flame arrives in Paris, marking the start of the Bastille Day celebrations.
• The Olympic torch will feature prominently during the Bastille Day parade.

• The Gambian government has maintained its ban on female genital cutting despite pressure to repeal it.
• The ban aims to protect women and girls from the harmful practice.
• Despite the ban, some girls continue to undergo the procedure, often secretly.

• Indians express support for Donald Trump amidst violent protests.
• Frustration and flooding reported in areas near an upscale Indian wedding event.

• Leo Varadkar announces his decision to step down as leader before the next Irish election.
• The exact timing of his departure has not been disclosed.
• His resignation is expected to have significant implications for the country's political landscape.

• 50 people have been reported as killed in the latest Israeli strikes on Gaza.
• Since October 7, 2021, Israel has claimed that they have killed over half of Hamas' military leadership.
• The Israeli military seems to be wary about going to war with Lebanon.
• In Gaza, it was stated that 90 people were killed during an attack from Israel that targeted a high-ranking Hamas military leader named Mohamed Deif.

• A series of unsolved murders has taken place in Kenya, sparking widespread concern about the lack of justice.
• The case has garnered significant attention due to its similarity to previous cases involving unidentified killers.
• Investigators are working tirelessly to uncover clues and apprehend the perpetrator(s), with several suspects already under scrutiny.

• The Islamic State group has claimed responsibility for a deadly attack in Oman.
• No further details have been provided regarding the specifics of the attack or its impact on the local population.
• Omani authorities are likely to investigate and respond to this incident accordingly.

• The Spain national football team chanted "Gibraltar is Spanish" during their Euro 2020 victory celebrations.
• This chant highlights the ongoing dispute between Spain and Gibraltar over sovereignty of the territory.
• The statement reinforces Spain's claim to Gibraltar despite its recent annexation by Britain in 1707.

• Two British citizens go missing in Sweden.
• Bodies discovered inside a car.
• The identities of the victims remain unknown.

• 6 people were found dead in a hotel room in Bangkok.
• Two of those who died were from America.
• Officials are trying to find out why they died.

• Princess Kate will present the trophy to the men's Wimbledon winner.
• This is according to an official statement from the palace.
• The event takes place during the Wimbledon tennis tournament.

• Trump had his security increased after an Iranian plot was discovered to kill him.
• Defeated Trump opponents spoke out for unity during the Republican Convention.
• Senator Bob Menendez has been found guilty of bribery.
• Joe Biden is considering major changes to the US Supreme Court.
• Trump recently appeared at a convention after being shot.
